Why do some antivirus software like Avast and Kaspersky flag the Verus software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP"?

Some antivirus software may flag the Verus software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP" (Potentially Unwanted Program) because it includes mining software, which could be used by a third party to exploit your PC. This is a false positive warning, and you can learn more about it from the resources provided.

Avast and Kaspersky may flag the software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP". These are warnings that you are installing mining software, which may be installed by a third party to exploit your PC.
To find out more about the false positives, review the following resources:
https://blog.malwarebytes.com/detections/pup-optional-bitcoinminer/
https://www.kaspersky.com/blog/not-a-virus/18015/
At block 800200, The Verus mainnet protocol was updated to include VerusID. This update is the latest for the upgraded Verus mainnet.This release fixes an issue that does not generally affect the Verus network, but can corrupt individual wallets in the case of a specific type of reorg occurrence that is relatively rare, but can happen. We STRONGLY RECOMMEND that all users upgrade to version 0.6.0-6 asap.This release includes activation support for VerusID, and relative adjustment to the CPU and FPGA-equalizing VerusHash 2.1 Algorithm# Verus ID

What updates were made to the Verus mainnet protocol at block 800200, and why are they important?

At block 800200, the Verus mainnet protocol was updated to include VerusID, which is a fully functional blockchain protocol. This update is important because it fixes an issue that can corrupt individual wallets in the case of a specific type of reorg occurrence, although it is relatively rare. It is strongly recommended that all users upgrade to the latest version as soon as possible.

What is VerusID, and how does it differ from other blockchain ID implementations?

VerusIDs are a fully functional blockchain protocol, not just an ID system. Unlike most blockchain ID implementations, there is no corporation involved in the protocol. VerusIDs provide plenty of opportunities for identity applications and offer features such as revocability, recoverability, and quantum-ready friendly crypto addresses on the Verus worldwide network.
